answers.answer: Hi JenFemales  can have Tg antibodies without thyroid disease.There are other diseases associated with Tgab such as  Pernicious anemia, addison's disease, diabetes mellitus. Sj

Hi!!!  Thanks for all the info...sounds like a lot of things can cause Thyroid symptoms...pretty scary.  Anyway, I think my problem could be thyroid related...I've got the hx. of Premature Ovarian Failure (autoimmune, Family Hx. of Hashimoto's and I feel LOUSY...maybe if my TSH was lower I would feel better and be less TIRED!!!  I have an appt. to get this all checked out next Monday...I'll ask for my T-3 and T-4 to be tested....thanks again for your input.  Jen in NJ

question: Hi!!! I'm 39, female and was just wondering about these thyroid test results...so many conflicting ideas and ranges. My TSH is 2.2 and my TgAb is 58 which is positive...but my TpoAb is <10 which is negative....so the question is what do I have.  I've had no other thyroid testing done...I'm sure I need more.  I have an appt. next week to try to get some answers.  I have alot of hypoT symptoms, fatigue, weight gain, either hot or cold, dry hair,high chol/triglycerides, High BP, insomnia, pre-diabetes. And, I also have Premature Ovarian Failure which put me into menopause at 28...this is autoimmune disoder....maybe I've got another one now (ie: Hashimoto's).  And, my grandmother had Hashimoto's and needed her goiter removed.  Any thoughts would be great!!!!  Jen In NJ
title: TSH/Antibodies Questions
